reviews.text: Bartenders concoctions are customized to your preference and they do a fantastic job!!! I was happy with my passion fruit martini! Had some rosemary and lime in it. Also had a whiskey sour which was bomb. Service was great!! Our bartenders were super friendly and also gave recs for things to eat and do in the city! Highly recommend!

Cocktail Paradise: A Must-Visit for Drink Lovers

If you’re after a one-of-a-kind drinking experience in Singapore, this is the place to be! I’ve visited multiple times, and the creativity of the mixologists never fails to amaze me.

Here’s the magic: just share your choice of liquor, preferred flavors, and vibe (refreshing, sour, sweet, tropical—you name it), and they’ll craft a unique cocktail tailored just for you. My first visit? I asked for a berry, lime, and gin-based experience, and they created six incredible variations—tropical, refreshing, and more. They even handed me a box of fresh raspberries. Talk about going the extra mile!

Though the vegetarian food options are limited, the drinks alone are worth the trip.

Ratings
Cocktails: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Service: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Ambience: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆
Food: ⭐⭐⭐☆☆

TL;DR: Inventive cocktails, stellar service, and an unforgettable experience. Drink lovers, don’t miss this spot!
This upstairs spot has some incredibly talented mixologists.  The cocktails are invented on the spot based upon your spirit choice and preferred flavor profile.  Just delicious.

This cocktail bar is a true hidden gem!  It's tucked away in an unassuming, casual space overlooking the colorful Haji Lane (look for the stairwell to the right of Habibi-san!).  There's no set cocktail menu, so come with your ideas and  preferences, and head mixologist Dave and his team will craft a custom cocktail to your liking.  Literally every drink I had was well-balanced, delicious, and really reflected the notes I had given.  You can order food off the Habibi-san! menu, which is a fusion of Middle Eastern and Japanese flavors - and it all works surprisingly well together.  I had the roasted brussel sprouts  with bonito, mentaiko labne with tobiko, babaganoush, and several kushiyaki skewers (pork jowl and chicken hearts) - and it was all delicious.  You can't go wrong with a place that melds exceptional cocktails, tasty food, and truly friendly + fun staff (Kalai and Dave were so memorable!) - I highly recommend this!

I visited Bar Stories, a bar located on the second floor of a restaurant-bar combo. While I didn’t try the food, the dishes at neighboring tables looked quite appealing, and the place was packed, so reservations are definitely a must. Fortunately, we were able to secure a spot just 30 minutes before arriving and were seated at the bar counter.

One of Bar Stories’ defining features is that they don’t have a drinks menu, which allows the bartenders to get creative. While this could imply a higher level of craftsmanship, the result didn’t quite live up to the hype. We ordered two drinks, both of which were visually impressive—one with a flaming fruit garnish and another topped with a torched marshmallow. However, we noticed that the bartender repeated the same dramatic touches for multiple drinks throughout the night, which made the experience feel a bit less special. For the $30 price tag per drink, I had expected a more unique or personalized experience.

The bar was busy, and service was a little slow, but overall, the atmosphere was decent. It’s a place with a lot of potential, but the repetitiveness of the drink presentation took away from the novelty.
